Dialogue: ALL LOCATIONS, CHARACTERS, ORGANIZATIONS, AND INCIDENTS
DEPICTED IN THIS DRAMA ARE ENTIRELY FICTITIOUS
They say you can't choose to die peacefully in your sleep
no matter how rich you are.
And Hye-suk managed to do it.
It's because this family has such good luck.
Mom, Dad, and even the daughter-in-law all passed away in their sleep.
That's my dream, too, you know?
I feel so bad for my brother.
When I end up lying there…
It seems like an artificial joint. What do you want to do with it?
Well, if you want us to discard it, we can.
I'll do some grocery shopping tomorrow.
I'm not having breakfast, don't bother.
Have a fried egg at least!
{\an8}Why would you treat us? It's fine.
{\an8}I should since you came all the way to the funeral.
{\an8}Mi-jeong, I didn't know you lived that far away. It took forever.
{\an8}How do you commute from there every day?
{\an8}Where did you put your mom's urn?
{\an8}I heard it was illegal to scatter them.
{\an8}Aren't the urns also managed in some system or something?
What do you think dying is? It means you're out of the system.
How could we leave her somewhere else?
So it's okay to keep it at home.
It still doesn't feel real, does it?
I still don't know what's going on.
and said they don't move patients who are in cardiac arrest.
We asked them desperately to take her to the hospital,
Then the police came to see my mom lying in the bedroom.
"Did you have a fight?" "How many insurance policies do you have?"
Why didn't you pick up? I've been calling you since before.
I fried some anchovies and shrimp. Pick them up when you finish work.
Hey, your father's a widower now. Tell him to eat whatever's offered.
I'll have 300g of beef for soup and 2.4kg of pork ribs.
I see. 300g of beef for soup and 2.4kg of pork ribs.
Why didn't you just take a taxi?
Hey, Mom definitely died from overwork.
Why do I have to go all the way to Wangsimni to pick up some food?
She doesn't even know what you like. She just pretends to care.
I almost threw them out on my way home.
I know she doesn't care about you. Why does she have to pretend she does?
She must be doing this to get money from you.
If she even talks about it, I'll go show her what's what.
Don't you know who put Mom through all that?
Give me your seal later, Dad.
We'll go and bury it somewhere.
If you let your sister have her way again, we're done.
I don't even care if we're family. I won't see you again!
I mean, she used to come every day.
She goes straight home after work these days.
Yes, she should. Her father must be lonely by himself.
I heard her brother quit his job and stays at home.
Goodness, it's a pity she passed away so soon.
You didn't even get to meet her.
To think that someone I saw in the afternoon passed in the evening…
She must have wanted to meet her son-in-law before she left.
{\an8}How could you say that in front of her?
{\an8}So I was like, "What?" And I looked up.
{\an8}And he said, "Ms. Yeom Gi-jeong bad-mouthed me a lot, didn't she?"
{\an8}All the people I've heard so much about were gathered there,
{\an8}so I kind of got excited and put my foot in my mouth.
{\an8}I was like, "So this is what a funeral can be like."
{\an8}That the girl Gi-jeong said had "nasty" written all over her face must be pretty.
{\an8}I picked her out immediately among all her colleagues. "It's her!"
"The girl who has 'nasty' written all over her face. That's her, right?"
It came out that she lied, you know?
I was even more shocked when your mom passed away
than when my mom passed away.
Maybe because I didn't see it coming at all.
It's natural that you come and you go.
But I wish everyone could leave at the right time.
You'll feel different when you become 80.
My grandpa used to look at old people and say
he didn't want to live that long.
I asked, "Grandpa, aren't you supposed to pass away this year?"
Just like that, he managed to live until he was 90.
And he still said it wasn't time yet.
What if we have a system
where all humans live up to 100?
Then I'll form a militia when I'm 99.
I'll run from the system into the mountains.
There's no such thing as the right time.
But your mother chose a good day.
We got three days off thanks to your mom.
No matter how you look at it,
Gi-jeong's the luckiest one here, right?
It would have been shameless if she was looking for a guy to date
But it's as if she knew something like this was going to happen.
It was as if she was possessed.
Pretending to have lost her memories after getting rejected.
She was so desperate. She grabbed onto him in such a hurry.
And then her mom passed away.
she would be blameless if she decided to move out.
Seeing that her boyfriend has visited for three days in a row,
And Chang-hee also quit his job
That must have been why I wanted to quit so badly.
But in retrospect, I didn't want to quit that badly.
It just felt like the right time to quit.
I guess my soul just knew.
who would take care of my dad?
After the three of us go to work, and without Gu, he'd be all by himself.
The thought makes me tear up.
I was like this when I was younger, too.
When I was in high school, my homeroom teacher said
we'd be in trouble if anyone skipped the after-school classes.
I had never skipped them before,
but I really wanted to go home that day for some reason.
It wasn't like I had anything to do at home. I just wanted to go home.
My grandma was alone at home.
her eyes were open, but she wouldn't answer me.
I felt like I had to hold her hand so I did.
I suddenly got scared, so I pulled my hand away.
So I held her hand tight again.
"Where did you go, leaving Grandma alone?"
It was the first time in my life telling Dad off like that.
He couldn't say a thing and just listened to me.
If I hadn't skipped school that day,
my grandma would've passed away all alone.
Just like this, my soul knows and my body just follows.
I would be waiting for Gi-jeong to come home.
After spending the whole day with my dad alone,
when Gi-jeong and Mi-jeong come home…
I hope you remember that Oh Du-hwan is also feeling lonely somewhere.
And this song is for us.
Just your name alone Makes my heart ache
Why didn't I know That you'd be leaving so far away
My love I guess this is our goodbye
The times I've sulked at you Without good reason
And the times I've been Too harsh and negligent
I never got to tell you How sorry I am
My love I guess this is our goodbye
No matter how many times I tell myself
That it'd be okay And that you'd understand
-Come a step too late as regret -It's cold. Let's go.
If only for a day I could see you again
I would cry for hours on end In your presence
Even the wind sounds So quiet in the sky today
My love I guess this is our goodbye
It still bothers me that Mr. Gu didn't come.
Don't you have any way of contacting him?
They don't even know his name.
How could she not know the name of the person she dated?
No matter how many times I tell myself
That it'd be okay And that you'd understand
Come a step too late as regret
If I get to see you once again
-I will thank you before it's too late -Mom. It's snowing.
He just saved her as my name.
I'm saved as "Yeom Mi-jeong" with "Temporary Employee" in brackets.
Would you like to see who it is?
He saved the girl he's having an affair with as "Mi-jeong"?
Who on earth is the woman?
People kept whispering about Mi-jeong at the funeral.
They said she was dating him to get a permanent position.
Can't you sue him for that?
Are you busy? Can I stop by?
The number you have called is not in service.
Please check the number and try again.
My asshole team leader is having an affair with some employee,
and he saved her number under my name.
Since everyone knows he hates me,
he must've thought it'd be safe if he saved it under my name.
I knew he was having an affair.
A while back, I called the two of them since they were late for a meeting.
And it was eerily identical how both calls were so silent.
There wasn't any background noise, as if they were in a vacuum.
It became so obvious after that.
When I saw a shampoo in her bag,
I wondered why she would carry shampoo around.
It was to avoid smelling the same by using different shampoos.
When that asshole would start ranting at me…
{\an8}Font combination, color coordination, color choice, is that so hard?
{\an8}-I mean, is it hard? -She would suddenly
{\an8}align a stack of papers with a "tap"
{\an8}I'd end up looking at her hands,
{\an8}At first, I was grateful for her fingertips
{\an8}I want to break all of her fingers.
{\an8}MS. YEOM, CAN WE TALK FOR A MOMENT?
{\an8}I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU THINK YOU KNOW
{\an8}Don't respond. He must be quaking in his boots.
{\an8}Just ignore it. Don't even read them.
It's fine. It doesn't take that long if I take the subway, anyway.
I have to drive you home today.
Besides, my sister made some dishes for you.
Wait here. The ribs are upstairs.
-Have a seat. -You didn't have to make ribs.
Tae-hun even paid me to make them for you.
I've been a bit busy these days.
It's been a while since I drank beer.
that it gets harder if I drink.
I know if I drink just a little like this,
it'll be harder on my way home.
I live quite far away, you see.
I know very well it'll be hard.
But I don't want to be strong.
I just want to be knocked out.
I always feel okay again the next day.
If you don't like it, just give me the axe, all right?
Just think of it as bad luck.
Who on earth would think you two are having an affair?
Do you know who it is?
The woman he's having an affair with.
You can't do this to me.
I took care of you, and this is how you repay me?
you shouldn't have done that at the funeral.
Giggling and playing footsie under the table!
Why does it feel like that's you?
Something that feels so out of place
I saw messages from someone set as my name.
I've never done anything like that with Mr. Choi.
Then why would Mr. Choi's wife have called me?
My wife says she's never called the company.
She says she never called here looking for Yeom Mi-jeong.
How would I know who did what?
It's too bad this kind of incident occurred before your review
On top of that, the assault.
We can't let you guys work in the same department.
She came by here that very day. How could she pass away just like that?
I saw Mi-jeong crying her eyes out saying she'd lost her dog.
So I asked if she'd found it,
but she said she didn't have a dog, so I asked, "Well, was it a goat then?"
That day, the day she passed.
What about your dad? Is he holding up alright?
You take good care of him.
and Mi-jeong's just the same, I guess.
who can't cry unless she plucks up the courage.
Sure. Don't forget to send me photos to let me know you're home later.
Hey. You're back early. Did you take the afternoon off?
Why did you take out a loan?
HANJO EMERGENCY FUND EASY LOAN LOAN AMOUNT 2,000,000 WON
I beat someone up a bit. It's for the settlement.
But why did you need to get a loan? You don't have two million won?
-Show me your bankbook now! -Are you my mom?
You lent money to Chan-hyeok, didn't you?
Why the hell did you hit her?
Yeom Je-ho was ripped off by his little sister.
But what kind of idiot lends money to her boyfriend?
Are you not going to tell me? Damn it.
Do you have no family? No mom, no dad?
She saw how I was treated after my trouble with money.
I wouldn't, either. I'd rather starve to death.
I'd rather be in jail before letting any of you know.
When did we ever rely on our family?
Why are you ignoring me after proposing to me?
You're not even answering my calls.
Don't worry about it. Hyeon-a won't say yes, anyway.
He says you won't say yes.
Did you see the link I sent?
and that's the best place. And it's clean.
Let's put your mom's urn there.
I want mine to be there, too.
I want to go wherever you put your mom.
You should stay with your mom.
My mom is going to live very long.
And I'm not expecting any visitors.
You'll come see me if I'm placed next to your mom.
I'll reserve spots for you and Hyeon-a, too.
So you're going to take us with you?
No, you guys take your time.
Let's stay together, even when we're dead.
So that we won't be bored.
You should ask her yourself. Aren't you closer to her than me?
I carry on thanks to you.
for a family of four to be happy…
I think it's my first time coming to the beach with Dad.
It's the first time we've come to the beach as a family.
When it was just you and me,
I have memories of going places with Mom and Dad.
But nothing after Mi-jeong was born.
It's because it was hard for all five of us to go around on buses and trains.
It's because Auntie got into trouble then. And ever since then, nothing.
The villain of our family is Auntie.
That sounds scary. I'm going to be an aunt one day.
Hey, it's not possible for us to become an aunt who robs her family.
That's why he cared for her and sold off his own land.
But this asshole doesn't love us that much.
I would give you everything if I had anything.
I just can't because I don't.
Hey. Once we get married, let's not bother each other over money.
Yes. Let's not ever do that.
On second thought, I think I'd give you money, too.
But you need to know this.
We can do that because we love each other.
But do you think our children will love us that much?
I don't think so, you know? That's the problem.
Dad loved Aunt, but we didn't. That's the problem.
That's why they say you can get away with anything if you have love.
the three of us by your side, Dad.
I thought I was taking care of them all this time.
I only realized after she passed away…
were the ones taking care of me.
But why do I keep tearing up?
Have you managed to liberate yourself?
Have you met someone who worships you?
Lose some weight in an hour and meet me.
I was so angry waiting for you to call.
It's not like you don't know where I live.
I thought you'd be able to if you really wanted to.
You never called my previous number.
It sounds real now that I've said it.
It feels like I really missed you so much.
I wanted to squeeze you and swallow you down in one mouthful.
Aren't I good at worshiping now?
Why didn't you call me sooner?
He'd never let me hit rock bottom.
Do you want a part-time job?
We agreed to get married when she turns 20.
But when she's 20, I'll be 50. Damn it.
Didn't you say it was over between you two?
I've always known what kind of a person you are.
